title: Datatec slides after trading update | Telecoms & Technology
text:
Picture: THINKSTOCK Related articles Datatecâ€™s star soars in spite of volatility Datatec buys Trovus to boost analytics offering Datatec in second German purchase In this article JSE-listed companies: Datatec DTC View company tearsheet DATATEC shares slid more than 8% in early trade on Wednesday after the technology group released a relatively weak trading update.
Datatec said it expected headline earnings per share (HEPS) in the six month to August to drop by 25% from the year-earlier period due to emerging market currencies being weaker against the dollar.
In this regard, total foreign exchange losses in the review period amounted to $10.6m.
"In particular, the imposition of capital controls at the end of 2014 in Angola and the devaluation of the Angolan kwanza resulted in a foreign exchange loss of $8.9m at Westcon," it said in a statement.
In morning trade, the stock was up 8.83% at R67.10, giving the company a market cap of R14bn.
